nl.tue.geometrycore.io.ipe

Class IPEWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.io.BaseWriter<java.lang.String,java.lang.Appendable>
      • nl.tue.geometrycore.io.ipe.IPEWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, GeometryRenderer<java.lang.Appendable>, LayeredWriter

    public class IPEWriter
extends BaseWriter<java.lang.String,java.lang.Appendable>
implements LayeredWriter
    Writer for the IPE XML format. It can handle both files as well as selection code, allowing easy copy-pasting to IPE from Java.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class nl.tue.geometrycore.io.BaseWriter

      • getA4Size

        public static Rectangle getA4Size()
        Provides the page dimensions to get an A4-sized page in IPE.
        Returns:
        new rectangle of 595 by 842

        Provides the page dimensions for a 4:3 presentation in IPE.
        Returns:
        new rectangle of 800 by 600

        Provides the page dimensions for a 16:9 view in IPE.
        Returns:
        new rectangle of 1920 by 1080

      • clipboardWriter

        public static IPEWriter clipboardWriter()
        Creates an IPE writer that will output the result to the clipboard, suitable to be pasted into IPE. Note that the clipboard contents are also returned when invoking .close().
        Returns:
        new instance of IPEWriter

      • clipboardWriter

        public static IPEWriter clipboardWriter(boolean fileMode)
        Creates an IPE writer that will output the result to the clipboard, either the complete file (fileMode is true) or suitable for pasting into IPE (fileMode is false). Note that the clipboard contents are also returned when invoking .close().
        Parameters:
        fileMode - whether to write the full file content
        Returns:
        new instance of IPEWriter

      • fileWriter

        public static IPEWriter fileWriter(java.io.File file)
        Creates an IPE writer that will write the full file contents to the provided file. Note that the return value of .close() will be null.
        Parameters:
        file - file to be created or overwritten
        Returns:
        new instance of IPEWriter

                                   boolean fileMode)

      • setView

        public void setView(Rectangle view)
        Sets up the view area for the document (in file mode). Resets any specified transformation. This method should only be used before calling .initialize() on the writer.
        Parameters:
        view - rectangle specifying the view area

      • setNoNamedValues

        public void setNoNamedValues()
        Shorthand for disabling all named values for IPE. Note that this effectively disables transparency, since these can only be named.

      • setTransparencies

        public void setTransparencies(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> namedTransparencies)
        Configures which transparency values are used. Note that transparencies must be named in IPE; specifying an alpha value will look for the closest value in this map. An alpha value of 1 (fully opaque) need not be included. Setting this to null will use the values from IPEDefaults. This method should only be used before calling .initialize() on the writer.
        Parameters:
        namedTransparencies - map encoding names

      • setNamedColors

        public void setNamedColors(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Color> namedColors)
        Configures which colors are converted to named values. Setting this to null will use the values from IPEDefaults. This method should only be used before calling .initialize() on the writer.
        Parameters:
        namedColors - map encoding names

      • setNamedStrokewidths

        public void setNamedStrokewidths(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> namedWidths)
        Configures which strokewidths are converted to named values. Setting this to null will use the values from IPEDefaults. This method should only be used before calling .initialize() on the writer.
        Parameters:
        namedWidths - map encoding names

      • setNamedSymbolsizes

        public void setNamedSymbolsizes(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> namedSizes)
        Configures which symbol sizes are converted to named values. Setting this to null will use the values from IPEDefaults. This method should only be used before calling .initialize() on the writer.
        Parameters:
        namedSizes - map encoding names

      • setNamedDashing

        public void setNamedDashing(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Dashing> namedDashing)

        Parameters:

      • setWorldview

        public void setWorldview(Rectangle world)
        Sets up a transformation such that the provided rectangle in worldspace is rendered in the view rectangle (provided with setView()). Provide null as a parameter to clear the transformation. This method can be called after writing geometries to a page, but the old transformation cannot be recovered.
        Parameters:
        world - the area in worldspace to be seen in the view area

      • closePage

        public void closePage()
        Closes the current page. This method should only be used for writers in file mode.

      • newPage

        public void newPage(java.lang.String... layers)
        Starts a new page with the given list of layers. Layer names may not contain whitespaces. If no layers are specified, one layer "default", is created. A call to this method must be followed by one or more calls to newView() to specify the visible layers. This method should only be used for writers in file mode.
        Parameters:
        layers - layers for the new page

      • newView

        public void newView(java.lang.String... visible)
        Specifies a new view with the given list of layers visible. If no layers were specified during newPage(), then a view with the default layer visible is created. This method should only be used for writers in file mode.
        Parameters:
        visible - visible layers in the new view

        Throws:

      • configureTextHandling

        public void configureTextHandling(boolean scaleText,
                                  double baseTextSize,
                                  boolean useTextDiscrepancy)
        Configures how text is positioned and sized. If scaleText is true, transformations on the text items are set to "affine" and matrix transformations are used to determine the text size, using the given baseTextSize as the font size to be scaled. If set to false, then the font size is configured directly: no scaling is performed and transformations on the text are set to "rigid". Note that this may give warped text if the resulting font size is very small or very big. Raster rendering and IPE's text size scale differently. useTextDiscrepancy indicates whether compensation needs to happen, using IPEDefaults.TEXT_DISCREPANCY. Set to false to use IPE's text sizing.
        Parameters:
        scaleText -
        baseTextSize -
        useTextDiscrepancy -

      • getRenderObject

        public java.lang.Appendable getRenderObject()
        Description copied from interface: GeometryRenderer
        Returns the render object used by this renderer. This object can be used for more customized render handling, but breaks from the genericity of renderers. For advanced use only. May return null.
        Specified by:
        getRenderObject in interface GeometryRenderer<java.lang.Appendable>
        Returns:
        object for custom rendering
